column4: i've been unable to get my wireless running, i have the ssid, password, dhcp auto, etc set up correctly, sudo ifup wifi0 reports network is down... any suggestions please?
it's a d-link, reported as intersil corporation prism 2.5 wavelan chipset
does ifconfig show two entries or three
any drivers installed for that card?
according to device manager, hostap_pci is installed
do you have the bus ID on that?
as in info.bus? that's reported type: string and value: pci
did you see my last reply?
it seems from the forums that ndiswrapper is the best for that card; can you get hold of the windows drivers?
sorry to keep bothering you, do you have a minute or two?
it seems that ndiswrapper is the best bet for that card; do you have the windows drivers
probably in a dusty box somewhere, should i dl ndiswrapper and then copy it over to the ubuntu machine?
that seems to be the best choice at this point; lots of bugs in launchpad and gutsy with that card--many of them closed unresolved
thanks for your help... any recommendations on a cheap new card that would work well? ;)
this is for a desktop or a laptop
atheros perhaps but avoid broadcom if at all possible
